guide.title: Gentoo Linux Installer Frequently Asked Questions
guide.abstract: This FAQ attempts to answer all of the questions (even the stupid ones) that people ask over and over.

section.title: Will the installer run from the 2005.1 minimal/universal CD?

body.p: No. At the minimum, the installer requires parted, pyparted, and pythondialog which are not on the official release CDs.
No, it will be done when it's done.

Yes, but it's only at version 0.2 and still has many bugs. You can obtain an experimental ISO with X and the installer at /experimental/x86/livecd/x86/ on your favorite mirror. The file is called livecd-x86-installer-2005.1-r1.iso, however the name is subject to change.

section.title: Does/will the installer support architecture X?

body.p: The first release of the installer is only planned to support x86 and amd64. There are plans to support sparc, hppa, and ppc in the future.

If you are using true hardware RAID, the installer will see the array as a normal drive (because the kernel sees it this way too). As for LVM and fake RAID/md, the installer does not currently support them, but it will in the future.

section.title: Why doesn't the installer do such and such?

body.p: The installer is currently under heavy development and is only in its early releases. Our intention is to support everything you can do from the commandline in the installer itself. If you have time and are willing to help on a feature, see the section titled "How can I help?"

section.title: I like the manual install. Why are you forcing me to use a graphical installer?

body.p: The current install method will always be an option. The installer will be distributed on a true LiveCD that contains xorg, Gnome, fluxbox, mozilla, and other goodies. There will still be a minimal CD that has just enough stuff to boot and install by hand.

section.title: Gentoo is too hard to install and I feel like whining.

body.p: Please see /dev/null.

section.title: Will the gentoo installer configure my such and such hardware for me?

body.p: No. The installer will only do what is covered in the install guide.

section.title: Where can I find more information about the installer?

body.p: On the project pages. Currently, there is no documentation. You can either read the source or ask in #gentoo-installer. If you ask any questions covered by this FAQ, you will most likely be ignored.

section.title: What's wrong with the current installation method?

body.p: Absolutely nothing. The goal of the installer is to make installations faster, not easier. The original intention was to make an installer for doing automated deployments. While we still have this in mind, the end user aspect took precedence (mainly because it's prettier).

section.title: What language is the installer written in?

body.p: COBOL, of course! (it's actually python)

section.title: Does the installer have localization support?

body.p: Some basic code for localization of the frontends has been written, but it has not been integrated yet.

At the current time, we need testers. If you are good with python, take a look at the various TODO lists in the latest CVS snapshot. Otherwise, we'll accept good bug reports (/tmp/installprofile.xml and /var/log/install.log included from failures). In the near future, we will also need people to write documentation.

It depends on if it's a bug with the installer itself or the LiveCD that it's on. If it's an installer bug, file it under Gentoo Linux in the GLI component on bugs.gentoo.org. If you had an install failure, include the /tmp/installprofile.xml and /var/log/install*log files from the LiveCD (you'll need to grab these before you reboot). If it is a bug with the LiveCD, file it under "Gentoo Release Media", choose 2005.1 from the version list, and put "X LiveCD" or "installer LiveCD" somewhere in the summary.

section.title: I found a bug. What should I do?

body.p: Since this is still alpha software, there are bound to be bugs. Since the initial release, we have fixed many bugs that testers have reported. Among them are:

ul.li: install hangs at "Mounting local partitions" if there is unallocated space in your partition layout
install hangs at "Mounting local partitions" if you have 2 drives and the second one contains no partitions
"iteration over non-sequence" error when using lilo
choosing anything other than livecd-kernel in GTK frontend causes the bootloader to fail to install
partitioning fails when leaving NTFS partition intact
choosing "none" for cron daemon tries to 'emerge none'

body.p: There are also some commonly reported errors that are not installer bugs. The most common one is the install failing when trying to sync the portage tree when using the normal sync option. This is actually a portage bug. This bug has been fixed in later portage versions, but not in any of the released stage tarballs. For now, it can be worked around by using the snapshot or webrsync options.

If you've found a bug that isn't mentioned above, the first thing you should do is follow the directions above for grabbing and running the latest CVS snapshot. If you can reproduce the bug there, you should go to bugzilla and do a search for the problem that you're running into. If there isn't an existing bug (open or closed), you can file a new bug under in the "Gentoo Linux" section in the GLI component. Be sure to save /tmp/installprofile.xml and /var/log/installer.log from the livecd after your installer run. These files are essential for us to be able to debug the problem properly.

section.title: How can I get voice in #gentoo-installer?

body.p: Asking a question covered in this FAQ will get you kicked and possibly banned from the channel. If you are trying to use the installer without first having successfully completed an install using the existing method, go away. At this point, we are looking for bug testers. We only want meaningful bug reports, and it's hard to get to those through the flood of "what is a stage tarball URI?" and similar questions. We also do not care that you think the installer is stupid, will ruin Gentoo, etc. Once you have read through this FAQ, just join the channel and '/msg gibot voiceme' to get voice.
